title: In a triangle, if angle A is 45 degrees and angle B is 65 degrees, what is angle C? - Quora

response.answer_text: The three angles of a triangle have to add up to 180 degrees. In other words, angle A + angle B + angle C = 180. 45 + 65 + angle C = 180. 110 + angle C = 180 angle C = 180 - 110 angle C = 70 degrees

All the angles in a triangle when totalled up will be 180 degrees . Angle A is 45 Degrees and Angle B is 65 Degrees Both when added together equal 110 degrees . Your last angle would be 180 minus 110 or 70 Degrees . 70 degrees is your answer .
Considering it as a triangle ABC , sum of all angles = 180 so angle C = 180–110 (sum of angle A and angle B = 45+65 =110) angle C = 70
